qas.question: How are Freemasons invited to join a lodge?
How does one become a Freemason?

answers.text: The onus is on candidates to ask to join

qas.question: Can women ask to be a member of the Masonic Lodge?
How can you find a lodge to ask to be a member of?

answers.text: track down a local Lodge through the Internet

qas.question: Candidates for Freemasonry must do what before being initiated?

answers.text: will have met most active members of the Lodge they are joining

qas.question: Candidates are normally introduced to the lodge by whom?
Now days, many interested people find a Masonic Lodge using what?
Candidates are never what to a Masonic lodge?
What usually follows an initial inquiry of a candidate?
How are Freemasons asked to leave a lodge?

plausible_answers.text: The onus is on candidates to ask to join

qas.question: Why can't anyone become a Freemason?
Can pets ask to be a member of the Masonic Lodge?
What always follows an initial inquiry of a candidate?

context: Candidates for Freemasonry <a4_0>will have met most active members of the Lodge they are joining<a4_0/> before they are initiated. The process varies between jurisdictions, but the candidate will typically have been introduced by <a5_0>a friend<a5_0/> at a Lodge social function, or at some form of open evening in the Lodge. In modern times, interested people often <a3_0>track down a local Lodge through <a6_0>the Internet<a6_0/><a3_0/>. <a1_0><b10_0>The onus is on candidates to ask to join<b10_0/><a1_0/>; while candidates may be encouraged to ask, <a0_0><b9_0>they are <a7_0>never invited<b9_0/><a7_0/><a0_0/>. Once the initial inquiry is made, <a8_0><b12_0>an interview<b12_0/><a8_0/> usually follows to determine the candidate's suitability. If the candidate decides to proceed from here, the Lodge ballots on the application before he (or she, <a2_0><b11_0>depending on the Masonic Jurisdiction<b11_0/><a2_0/>) can be accepted.
